    public class ServiceInfo
extends java.lang.Object
implements I_ServiceConfig
    Holds data about a Service (immutable).

      • ServiceInfo

        public ServiceInfo(ClusterController glob,
                   I_ServiceManager manager,
                   java.lang.String typeVersion)
            throws ServiceManagerException
        Parameters:
        manager - can be null if you only want to parse typeVersion
        typeVersion - null: Choose default Service ServiceManager.getDefaultServiceName()
        "undef": Don't load the Service else: Load the given Service or throw exception Example: "SOCKET,1.0" or "RAM,1.0"
        Throws:
        ServiceManagerException

      • ServiceInfo

        public ServiceInfo(ClusterController glob,
                   I_ServiceManager manager,
                   java.lang.String type,
                   java.lang.String version,
                   ContextNode contextNode)
            throws ServiceManagerException
        From ServiceEnvClass and instanceId we build a string to lookup the key in the environment e.g. "/ehrserver/node/heron/persistence/topicStore/PersistenceService[JDBC][1.0]"
        Parameters:
        manager - can be null if you only wanted to parse typeVersion
        type - null: Choose default Service ServiceManager.getDefaultServiceName()
        "undef": Don't load the Service else: Load the given Service or throw exception
        ServiceEnvClass - The classname for environment lookup e.g. "queue" or "persistence"
        instanceId - The instance name of the Service e.g. "history" or "topicStore"
        Throws:
        ServiceManagerException

      • dumpServiceParameters

        public java.lang.String dumpServiceParameters()
        Dumps the parameters passed to the Service. So if you defined a property in the property file like this: 
        QueueService[CACHE][1.0]=com.privantis.common.queue.cache.CacheQueueInterceptorService,\
                        persistentQueue=JDBC,\
                        transientQueue=RAM
        It will be returnes logonservice a string: 
        com.privantis.common.queue.cache.CacheQueueInterceptorService,persistentQueue=JDBC,transientQueue=RAM
        This method can be used to partially change a Service property like in the following example: 
          ServiceInfo ServiceInfo = new ServiceInfo(glob, glob.getQueueServiceManager(), "JDBC", "1.0");
  Properties p = ServiceInfo.getParameters();
  p.setProperty("tablePrefix", "test_");
  glob.getProperty().set("QueueService[JDBC][1.0]", ServiceInfo.dumpServiceParameters());

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        for example "ProtocolService[IOR][1.0]"

      • getPrefix

        public java.lang.String getPrefix()
        Description copied from interface: I_ServiceConfig
        Gets the prefix for the implementing service. Suppose you have two services ('serviceA1' and 'serviceB2') both containing an attribute called 'directoryName'. Then without a context there is now way to distinguish between them. This method returns the prefix (the context). For example 'service/${serviceType}/' which would be 'service/serviceA1/'
        Specified by:
        getPrefix in interface I_ServiceConfig
        Returns:
